title: @Ask Riot. Which champsion mains are most likely to get banned for toxicty
body:
like... out of curiosity?
not  the champions that are banned because of scripting like {{champion:101}}  or  {{champion:74}}  level up bots in co-op vs AI.

 i mean banned because the player was toxic.

 what champion "attracts" toxic player or "turns people toxic"

replies.body:
(not calling anyone out)

Jungle mains and adc mains are the easiest role to get toxic in.
and thus the champions in said roles.

Jungle requires communication between 2 parties in order to form a successful gank, but in the case of miscommunication, well shit.

ADCs are squishy, and weak as all fucking hell, so people look for ways to dispose their anger.

I main ADC and often time supports get toxic when your playstyle doesn't sync with theirs, or vice versa. 

A Alistar support and I where doing good and everything was chill and we were winning bot lane when he called me a "f***ing re****" for not using my ult when he turret dived at level 5 and the enemies where half health as caitlyn. 

I handle toxicity pretty well as it has little effect on me; but I second his comment.

Jungle gets blamed for things all the time like if a lane is losing hard it's not the laners fault, its the jungler's fault.

I'm a little biased, as a support main.

but its usually my adc berating me for trying something new (which works btw).
for ex: I played Tahm kench with Glacial augment, my adc called me a dumbass and said he was gonna report me for trolling.
I proceeded to dominate my lane and got my Mid karthus 3 kills over 10 minutes.
we won.
he didn't even bother apologizing. 

also, when you are in the role, and you are a well mannered gentlemen, its pretty hard to see what I'm talking about.
I suppose that is true but I see the flip side, I used to main support but switched to ADC after a mate taught me about orb walking. Just report them after the game & move on.
pretty much all top main players are most toxic ????????????????? spammers
Let me guess, you're a jungler.

I know a few Jhin mains that got chat restricted/banned for toxicity, but they are generally nice and pretty chill.

If I had to say most toxic, my money would be on Yasuo mains. Its always a gamble with these assholes. Will they actually play the game and hard carry, or will they say "fuck it" and int because they feel like it? Will they acknowledge the fact that they made a mistake, or will they blame the team and troll them for the rest of the game/afk?

Maybe I'm a bit biased here because I just got out of an ARAM where our Yasuo main got 2 kills, disconnected, came back, sat in fountain, only bought {{item:3006}}, and ran out to feed the enemy a kill so he'd still be considered "in the game", but whatever.

Yasuo, Draven, Zed, Vayne, Akali, Katarina...

...basically any high-mechanical champ, because they believe they've outplayed you due to their dexterity, and love to rub it in your face.

Just my experience.

---

Caveat: One of the nicest, coolest player's on my friend's list happens to be a Yasuo main. So it's not a hard and fast rule.
